name: Humayun Ahmed
biography: Humayun Ahmed was a Bangladeshi author, playwright, and filmmaker. He is considered one of the most popular writers in Bengali literature.
influence: His works have inspired generations of readers and writers in Bangladesh and beyond.

name: Rabindranath Tagore
biography: Rabindranath Tagore was a Bengali polymath who reshaped Bengali literature and music, as well as Indian art with contextual modernism in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.
influence: His contributions to Bengali literature and music are immense, and his works continue to be celebrated worldwide.

name: Muhammad Zafar Iqbal
biography: Muhammad Zafar Iqbal is a Bangladeshi author, physicist, and activist. He is celebrated for his contribution to Bengali science fiction and children's literature.
influence: His works have inspired a whole generation of young readers and science enthusiasts in Bangladesh.

name: Shirshendu Mukhopadhyay
biography: Shirshendu Mukhopadhyay is a Bangladeshi author who has written over 200 novels and numerous short stories. He is known for his unique storytelling and vivid characters.
influence: His works have captivated readers of all ages and are considered classics in Bengali literature.

name: Kazi Nazrul Islam
biography: Kazi Nazrul Islam was a Bengali poet, musician, and revolutionary. He is commonly known as the 'Bidrohi Kobi' (Rebel Poet) for his activism and protest poetry.
influence: His poetry and music played a significant role in the Indian independence movement and continue to inspire artists and activists.

name: Syed Shamsul Haque
biography: Syed Shamsul Haque was a Bangladeshi poet, novelist, and playwright. He is considered one of the most versatile and innovative writers in Bengali literature.
influence: His works continue to inspire writers and readers alike, and he remains a towering figure in Bangladeshi literature.
